model_output:
The main theoretical perspectives on AI research framing future directions, as depicted in the provided corpus, can be categorized into three key areas:

1. Turing Test-oriented Approach [1]
   - Inception and objective: The Turing Test was proposed as a benchmark to assess machine intelligence by discerning responses of human or machine origin [1]. A machine passing the Turing Test is considered intelligent [1]. - Future directions: Researchers aim to create more powerful models that can successfully pass the Turing Test [1]. 2. Large Language Models (LLMs) and Trustworthy AI [2][3][4]
   - Contribution: LLMs have gained significant interest due to their performance in diverse tasks, leading some to consider them as AGI [2][3]. The importance of evaluating AI, identifying current system limitations, and designing more powerful models is emphasized [1]. - Trustworthy AI: Recent research focuses on understanding areas where such models may be abused, developing detection technologies, moderation mechanisms, government legislation, or platform policies to prevent misuse [2]. 3. Human Intelligence Analogies and Machine Intelligence Definition [6][7]
   - Binet's test results as a predictor of children's academic performance [7], which served as an early model for assessing intelligence. - Universal intelligence exploration in relation to mainstream views on human intelligence and other proposed definitions of machine intelligence [7].
